items.title: Government on track to shut down after midnight with no funding deal in sight
bullets: • The U.S
• government was set to shut down after midnight Tuesday

• House Speaker Mike Johnson said Democrats "need to come to their senses here, and do the right thing" Johnson accused Democrats of trying to protect Schumer's "backside" by pressing that and other demands

items.title: Spirit Airlines touts 'massive progress' in bankruptcy
bullets: • Spirit Airlines reaches agreement with debtholders for up to $475 million in financing
• Airline last month filed for its second Chapter 11 bankruptcy in less than a year
• Budget airline has been racing to cut costs and recently announced plans to cut 40 routes and furlough one-third of its flight attendants

items.title: FTC sues Zillow and Redfin alleging antitrust violation in online rental listings
bullets: • Zillow paid Redfin $100 million to essentially re-host rental listings on Redfin and its sites
• The FTC says Redfin agreed to terminate contracts with existing advertising customers and assisted in acquiring that business
• Redfin also agreed to stay out of the multifamily advertising market for up to nine years and reduce its role to merely syndicating listings

items.title: Trump says government shutdown likely as House Democrats call out Republicans for delaying votes before funding deadline – live
bullets: • Trump says government shutdown likely as House Democrats call out Republicans for delaying votes before funding deadline – live
• Government funding is set to expire at midnight ET; Republican speaker Mike Johnson pushed back House return in order to prevent further negotiations
• Undocumented immigrants are not eligible to enroll in subsidized programs like Medicaid, Medicare or the Affordable Care Act

items.title: Trump, Pfizer agree to lower U.S. drug prices, exempt company from pharma tariffs
bullets: • Pfizer has agreed to voluntarily sell its medications for less for Medicaid patients
• Pfizer will also guarantee the same "most-favored-nation" pricing on its new drugs for Medicare, Medicaid and commercial payers
• The company plans to invest $70 billion to reshore domestic drug manufacturing and research facilities

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: What is a government shutdown and why is this year’s threat more serious?
bullets: • The federal government is once again on the brink of a shutdown, unless Congress can reach a funding agreement before the start of the new fiscal year, on 1 October
• The White House has threatened permanent mass layoffs of government workers in the event of a government shutdown, adding to the roughly 300,000 it forced out earlier this year

items.title: US energy department cracks down on workers’ use of climate crisis language
bullets: • The US Department of Energy has told its employees to avoid using the words 'climate change' and 'decarbonization' The agency is the government’s largest funder of carbon-slashing technologies
• Also on the list are ‘energy transition’, ‘clean’ or ‘dirty’ energy” and ‘carbon/CO2 ‘Footprint’ Another set of words to be avoided: ‘Tax breaks/tax credits/subsidies’

items.title: US cities should be military training grounds, Trump says
bullets: • US cities should be military training grounds, US President Donald Trump says
• Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth declares an end to "woke" culture at the Pentagon
• Trump says civil disturbances are the 'enemy from within' and 'won't get out of control'

items.title: US heads toward first government shutdown in nearly seven years
bullets: • President Donald Trump said a government shutdown was 'probably likely' on Tuesday
• Republicans are pushing legislation to fund the government through 21 November
• Democrats are demanding a series of concessions from Republicans in exchange for funding
• They want to undo Republican cuts to Medicaid, the program providing healthcare to the poor

items.title: Pfizer agrees to offer discounted drugs through new federal website, Trump announces
bullets: • Pfizer agrees to offer all medications to Medicaid, the public health insurance plan for low-income Americans, at “most favored nation” pricing
• In the United States, prices for drugs were almost three times higher than those of 33 other countries in 2022

items.title: Chinese woman convicted after 'world's biggest' bitcoin seizure
bullets: • Chinese national pleads guilty to stealing £6.7bn worth of bitcoin
• He is believed to have stolen more than 128,000 of the world's most valuable bitcoins
• Police say they have been involved in the scam for more than five years

items.title: Nike will report earnings after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
bullets: • Nike is expected to report a decline in quarterly sales on Tuesday
• The sneaker giant has been implementing a turnaround plan, and some analysts are expecting it to improve
• The company faces multiple hurdles as it tries to gain back ground, including tariffs and intense competition

items.title: iOS 26.0.1, macOS 26.0.1 updates fix install bugs, new phone problems, and more
bullets: • Apple releases iOS 26.0.1, iPadOS 26.1 and MacOS Tahoe
• The latest software update fixes bugs for iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone Air, and iPhone Air
• The software update also fixes a bug that could cause app icons to appear blank

items.title: California’s newly signed AI law just gave Big Tech exactly what it wanted
bullets: • The new law requires companies with annual revenue of at least $500 million to report safety practices
• It does not require mandatory testing of AI systems
• The law replaces a previous version of the law that would have required testing and "kill switches" The law was passed last year

items.title: Behind the scenes with the most beautiful car in racing: The Ferrari 499P
bullets: • Ferrari's Hypercars are purpose-built, closed-top race cars with some of the most complex hybrid systems outside of Formula 1
• During the 24 hours of Le Mans this year, the winning car covered 3,276 miles (5,273 km) Ferrari leads the manufacturer's championship and the driver's championship with the #51 factory car

items.title: Here's what a shutdown means for Smithsonian museums, memorials and the zoo
bullets: • Smithsonian Institution receives about 62% of its budget from the federal government
• The National Zoo and the Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute may face closure
• The Smithsonian says it will use prior-year funds to remain open to the public
• Zoo webcams will be turned off if a government shutdown occurs

items.title: Is the “million-year-old” skull from China a Denisovan or something else?
bullets: • A fossil skull from China may be a million years old, but it's probably related to Denisovans
• The skull is one of three unearthed from a terrace alongside the Han River, in central China
• It was cracked and broken after hundreds of thousands of years under the crushing weight of river mud

items.title: Flights in Afghanistan grounded after internet shutdown
bullets: • The Taliban has not given an official reason for the shutdown, but said it would last until further notice
• The internet has been severely affected by the government's decision to cut access to the internet
• The UN has called on the Taliban to fully restore the internet to Afghanistan

items.title: For Netanyahu, avoiding a peace deal may now be worse than agreeing one
bullets: • For Netanyahu, avoiding a peace deal may now be worse than agreeing one
• Netanyahu's far-right allies have threatened to leave – and possibly collapse – his government if he makes too many concessions in ending the war
• In return, he is dangling the prospect of a new, more peaceful future for the region

items.title: Burnout and Elon Musk’s politics spark exodus from senior xAI, Tesla staff
bullets: • Senior staff at Tesla have been leaving the company over the past year
• Members of the company’s two-year-old artificial intelligence start-up have also left the company
• The move is part of a growing exodus of senior staff from the company's top ranks

items.title: Pasta meals from Trader Joe's and Walmart may be linked to a deadly listeria outbreak
bullets: • Public health authorities are urging people to throw away certain precooked pasta meals sold at two popular retailers over concerns that they could be contaminated with listeria
• The U.S

• Department of Agriculture issued an alert late last week about two products with specific use-by dates in late September and early October: Marketside Linguine With Beef Meatballs & Marinara Sauce, sold at Walmart

items.title: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO
bullets: • Spotify co-founder Daniel Ek will step down as CEO in January
• He will transition to a new role of executive chairman
• Ek co-founded the streaming music streaming service in Sweden in 2006
• Ek: "I always believed that Spotify could play an important role in revolutionizing listening"

items.title: With 'drug boat' strikes, Trump leans into war on terror tactic against cartels
bullets: • U.S
• should go after cartels like it did al-Qaida in the wake of the 9/11 attacks, says Sen
• Patel
• The White House has launched a series of strikes against drug cartels in the Caribbean
• The attacks have killed 11 people and injured more than 100 since 2001

items.title: Poll: Republicans get more of the blame than Democrats for a potential shutdown
bullets: • Poll: Republicans get more of the blame than Democrats for a potential shutdown
• NPR/PBS News/Marist poll: By a 38-27% margin, respondents said they would blame Republicans for a shutdown
• The finding adds a wrinkle to the pending shutdown deadline of midnight Tuesday

items.title: Entire Ukrainian family killed in Russian drone strike, officials say
bullets: • Couple and their two young sons, aged four and six, killed in Russian drone strike
• Bodies of the two children and their parents were later recovered from the wreckage
• Ukraine's air force said its units shot down 46 out of 65 Russian drones overnight

items.title: Pollen holds a secret that could save honeybees
bullets: • Symbiotic bacteria called Streptomyces produce antimicrobial compounds that fight deadly bee and plant pathogens
• Bees collect these bacteria along with pollen and store them in hives, creating a natural defense system
• This could lead to new, sustainable ways of protecting pollinators and crops

items.title: Government shuts down tonight barring a deal. And, U.S. military leaders gather in VA
bullets: • Government shuts down tonight barring a deal to fund the government
• U.S
• military leaders gather in VA to discuss Gaza deal with the U.N
• Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth is meeting with top military leaders
• Government shutdown deadline is midnight tonight

items.title: Germany thrived in the first China Shock. But the next one could prove catastrophic.
bullets: • Germany thrived in the first China Shock, but the next one could prove catastrophic
• The VDMA represents thousands of German companies that manufacture industrial machines and equipment
• In the past six months alone, production is down 4.5 percent
• Exports are nose-diving, job cuts and furloughs are mounting

items.title: New rocket fuel compound packs 150% more energy
bullets: • University at Albany has created a new high-energy compound that could revolutionize rocket fuel and make space flights more efficient
• The compound releases more energy relative to its weight and volume compared to current fuels
• In a rocket, this would mean less fuel required to power the same flight duration or payload and more room for mission-critical supplies

items.title: The hidden forces inside diamonds that could make tech 1,000x faster
bullets: • Virtual charges, which exist only during brief interactions with light, play a critical role in ultrafast material responses
• Using attosecond pulses on diamonds, they showed these hidden carriers significantly influence optical behavior
• The findings could accelerate the development of petahertz-speed devices, unlocking a new era of ultrafast electronics

items.title: First living cochlea outside the body shows how hearing really works
bullets: • Scientists have kept a tiny slice of the cochlea alive outside the body, directly witnessing how hair cells amplify sound
• The finding confirms a universal principle of hearing and could pave the way for long-sought treatments for hearing loss
• The innovation is a product of five decades of work illuminating the molecular and neural mechanisms of hearing

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
bullets: • This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
• Unlike duplication, its chromosomes split apart, reshaping its genome in surprising ways
• Discovery sheds light on evolution, conservation, and even cancer research
• The Atlas blue butterfly is increasingly threatened by climate change and human impact

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Refurbished Sonos headphones, speakers, and soundbars are up to 25 percent off right now
bullets: • Right now, Sonos is offering up to 25 percent off a range of refurbished Sonos devices
• The Sonos Era 100, Era 300, and the portable Move 2 are among the deals
• Deals include a one-year subscription of The Criterion Channel and a powerful HP gaming laptop

items.title: You can now preorder LG’s 6K 32-inch Thunderbolt 5 display for $2,000
bullets: • The new UltraFine 32U990A is the world’s first 6K display with Thunderbolt 5 connectivity built right in
• It can move data around at 120Gbps speeds without the need for a separate USB hub
• The display is currently available for preorder through B&H's online store for $1,999.99 with shipping expected to start on October 20th

items.title: Imgur is blocking users in the UK
bullets: • Image-sharing site Imgur has shut off access to UK users
• UK's data watchdog warned Imgur of a potential fine earlier this month
• Imgur will also block UK users from seeing content from the platform embedded on third-party sites like Reddit

items.title: Microsoft is giving Copilot AI faces you can chat with
bullets: • Microsoft is giving Copilot AI assistant an animated face to talk with
• The experimental “Portraits” feature in Copilot Labs is available in the US, UK, and Canada
• It provides 40 stylized human avatars that respond with natural expressions during real-time voice conversations

items.title: Beats redesigned its new Powerbeats Fit’s wing tip to be more comfortable and secure
bullets: • Beats has announced a new version of the Fit Pro wireless earbuds that launched in late 2021
• The Powerbeats Fit are available for purchase starting today through Apple’s online store for $199.99 in jet black, gravel gray, power pink, and spark orange color options
• You’ll still get features like hands-free Siri access, Find My tracking, and syncing across Apple devices through iCloud

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year
